Dallas C# SIG Jan meeting: Black Belt MVC

January 5, 2014

Register for the meeting here.

Abstract

So you’ve mastered the basics of Model View Controller, you understand Razor, and you’re productive. Fantastic! This talk seeks to help you master the advanced scenarios that many are not aware even exist. We will discuss custom filters, controller factories, custom strongly typed templates, and so much more. By the time you’re done, you’ll be amazed at the new options MVC will provide you.

Bio

Tim Rayburn is a Principal Consultant with Improving Enterprises, a software and project management consulting company in Dallas, TX. Since 2007 he has been annually awarded the Microsoft MVP for Connected Systems Development in recognition of his expertise and community leadership. He is the organizer of Dallas TechFest, where through the work of an amazing staff they bring an incredible multi-technology conference to life every year in Dallas. He is the author of “Entity Framework 4.1: Expert’s Cookbook”, with Devlin Liles, and can be found speaking across the nation of agile process, distributed architecture, and data access technologies. He lives in Arlington Texas with his amazing wife Kate and their loyal dog Gandalf.Tim Rayburn is a Principal Consultant with Improving Enterprises, a software and project management consulting company in Dallas, TX. Since 2007 he has been annually awarded the Microsoft MVP for Connected Systems Development in recognition of his expertise and community leadership. He is the organizer of Dallas TechFest, where through the work of an amazing staff they bring an incredible multi-technology conference to life every year in Dallas. He is the author of “Entity Framework 4.1: Expert’s Cookbook”, with Devlin Liles, and can be found speaking across the nation of agile process, distributed architecture, and data access technologies. He lives in Arlington Texas with his amazing wife Kate and their loyal dog Gandalf.

About us

The Dallas C# SIG meets monthly on the 1st Thursday from 6:30pm to 8:30pm at the Improving Enterprises offices in Addison, TX. Subscribe to receive email notifications about monthly meetings.
